review.body:
I have some notes in-line, but overall...

I'd appreciate it if this could be split into multiple commits.

1.  Refactor the library functions
2. Get rid of the `do_concat_dtb_overlays` task, since we've established that it's completely unnecessary - L4TLauncher doesn't process overlays concatenated to the kernel DTB that it reads, either from the extlinux config, nor from the android kernel-dtb partition. Instead, just install the dtb if UBOOT_EXTLINUX_FDT is set.  (I know this wasn't in your PR, but I think it would be a good idea to add)
3. Add the overlay support in the extlinux config. This should be kept separate from `TEGRA_PLUGIN_MANAGER_OVERLAYS`, since the extlinux ones are applied *in addition* to the ones attached to the bootloader's DTB.
4. Maybe switch to setting `UBOOT_EXTLINUX_FDT` by default for the device tree, too, for consistency. Just seems odd to have overlays in the config with out the base device tree.

And can you verify that all this works with UEFI signing enabled - i.e., that signing happens for all the overlays, so they all get their `.dtbo.sig` files installed?

pull_request.title: l4t-extlinux-config: add support for OVERLAYS
pull_request.body:
This PR adds support for OVERLAYS in extlinux.conf to meta-tegra.  I haven't found this feature officially documented anywhere but it's referenced in forums like https://forums.developer.nvidia.com/t/place-custom-overlay-file-via-extlinux-conf/298287.  This feature is useful for anyone who wants to be able to modify devicetree overlays listed in `TEGRA_PLUGIN_MANAGER_OVERLAYS` without the necessity to do a capsule update, either by hand modifying in their `/boot` directory or using the `TEGRA_SWUPDATE_BOOTLOADER_INSTALL_ONLY_IF_DIFFERENT` feature of the [swupdate demo](https://github.com/OE4T/tegra-demo-distro/tree/master/layers/meta-tegrademo/dynamic-layers/meta-swupdate#tegra_swupdate_bootloader_install_only_if_different).

If/when this commit goes in I have a backport I'm planning for r35 branches which will also pull in a rebased commit from r36 branches of edk2-nvidia to support this on Jetpack 5 targets as well.  I've tested to ensure this works on kirkstone, see https://github.com/OE4T/meta-tegra/compare/kirkstone...Trellis-Logic:meta-tegra:kirkstone+overlays-extlinux-feature?expand=1 for preview. This means all device tree content should be able to be synchronized with rootfs content across the Jetpack 5/6 release series.

For those who don't specify `USE_OVERLAYS_IN_EXTLINUX = "1"` there should be no change with this PR, devicetree overlays will continue to come from spiflash only.

One thing I didn't take on with this task but could... I don't believe the logic in `do_concat_dtb_overlays` [here](https://github.com/OE4T/meta-tegra/blob/651e0898cb47ccc86c0ed5c7617fcfeadd7fda1f/recipes-bsp/uefi/l4t-launcher-extlinux.bb#L50-L55) actually is used by anything as far as I can tell. I could rename this function to reference its dual use for copying overlays or remove the concatenate part.

If/when this goes in I'll also reference it in the wiki page at https://github.com/OE4T/meta-tegra/wiki/Using-device-tree-overlays or I could work on a reorg/retitle of this page since it's about more than just devicetree overlays at this point.

# Commit Text
As discussed in [1], overlay source on JP5/6 targets appears to come only from the update capsule content in spi flash and not from either the content appended to the extlinux dtb.  This means if a slot switch occurs the devicetree overlay content used will match the last capsule update as opposed to the content overlayed on the dtb file referenced in extlinux.conf.  This also means slot switches don't apply dtb overlay changes when using slot switching instead of capsule update as a software update strategy for non bootloader components (see the TEGRA_SWUPDATE_BOOTLOADER_INSTALL_ONLY_IF_DIFFERENT feature at [2] for example).

With this patch, add support for writing the OVERLAYS value in the extlinux.conf file.  Specifiying

```
UBOOT_EXTLINUX_FDT = "/boot/${DTBFILE}"
USE_OVERLAYS_IN_EXTLINUX = "1"
```
in your local.conf or machine config will
* Copy all .dtbo files in TEGRA_PLUGIN_MANAGER_OVERLAYS list into the /boot directory of the rootfs when building the l4t-launcher-extlinux.
* Reference each .dtbo file in the extlinux.conf file, applying it as a part of the ExtLinuxBoot process in L4TLauncher.

1: https://matrix.to/#/!YBfWVpJwNVtkmqVCPS:gitter.im/$OJAkyoJCMQDfiamxJGULUseBv7vgH2fJy9cVLMbhh4g?via=gitter.im&via=matrix.org&via=3dvisionlabs.com
2: https://github.com/OE4T/tegra-demo-distro/tree/master/layers/meta-tegrademo/dynamic-layers/meta-swupdate#tegra_swupdate_bootloader_install_only_if_different

# Testing

Testing on master with jetson-orin-nano-devkit-nvme

1. Set in the local.conf:
```
UBOOT_EXTLINUX_FDT = "/boot/${DTBFILE}"
USE_OVERLAYS_IN_EXTLINUX = "1"
IMAGE_INSTALL:append = " dtc"
```

2. After boot, generate a DTS copy of the first overlay using logic like this:
```
cat /boot/extlinux/extlinux.conf | sed -n 's/.*OVERLAYS[[:space:]]\+\([^,]*\).*/\1/p' | xargs cat | dtc -I dtb -O dts >  /boot/first-overlay-original.dts && cp /boot/first-overlay-original.dts /boot/first-overlay-modified.dts
```
3. Modify the /boot/first-overlay-modified.dts by adding a line `test = "overlay-modified"`.  The resulting difference should look like this:
```
diff /boot/first-overlay-original.dts /boot/first-overlay-modified.dts
--- /boot/first-overlay-original.dts
+++ /boot/first-overlay-modified.dts
@@ -7,6 +7,7 @@
                target-path = "/";

                __overlay__ {
+                        test = "overlay-modified";

                        reserved-memory {
                                #address-cells = <0x02>;

```
4. Convert the modified dts file into the first overlay in the OVERLAYS list:
```
dtc -I dts -O dtb -o /boot/first-overlay-modified.dtbo  /boot/first-overlay-modified.dts 
cat /boot/extlinux/extlinux.conf | sed -n 's/.*OVERLAYS[[:space:]]\+\([^,]*\).*/\1/p' | xargs cp /boot/first-overlay-modified.dtbo
```
5. reboot
6. Verify the test marker is added to the device-tree from the overlay
```
root@jetson-orin-nano-devkit-nvme:~# cat /proc/device-tree/test
overlay-modified
```

Add shopping cart functionality with checkout process and validation

- Implement ShoppingCart component with state management for cart items
- Add quantity controls for items in the cart
- Create delete confirmation modal for item removal
- Develop checkout modal with customer information form
- Validate user input for name, email, phone, and delivery address
- Style components with responsive design and animations
- Integrate error handling for form fields
- Add support for different payment methods and delivery options
- Create separate CSS file for shopping cart styles
- Add CLAUDE.md for project documentation and guidelines
- Introduce settings.local.json for permission configurations

issue.title: [wasp-agent] Add relevant alert and metric to detect duplicate wasp-agent deployment

issue.body:
Signed-off-by: Igor Bezukh <ibezukh@redhat.com>

Runbook PR: https://github.com/openshift/runbooks/pull/318

**What this PR does / why we need it**:
In an upgrade scenario it can happen that duplicate wasp-agent
deployment can appear, since previous wasp-agent deployments
were manual and in a different namespace.
Therefore in order to make sure the user is aware of it we
are adding an alert which will rely on the a metric of memory
overcommit percentage and presence of wasp namespace.


**Reviewer Checklist**
<!-- Check [Expectations from a PR](/CONTRIBUTING.md#expectations-from-a-pr) for the details -->

> Reviewers are supposed to review the PR for every aspect below one by one. To check an item means the PR is either "OK" or "Not Applicable" in terms of that item. All items are supposed to be checked before merging a PR. 

- [ ] PR Message
- [ ] Commit Messages
- [ ] How to test

issue.title: Existing authorized SSH keys in the VM guest are overwritten
issue.body:
**What happened**:
Custom authorized SSH keys that were added to the file `~/.ssh/authorized_keys` are removed by kubevirt.

**What you expected to happen**:
The custom keys should not be removed.

**How to reproduce it (as minimally and precisely as possible)**:
1. Create a secret with a public SSH key.
2. Create a VM with `AccessCredentials` that refer the secret and use the `qemuGuestAgent` propagation method.
3. Run the VM, log in and add a second key to `~/.ssh/authorized_keys`.
4. Change the key in the secret, and wait until it is propagated to the VM.

The `~/.ssh/authorized_keys` will not contain the second key that was not added by kubevirt.

issue.title: Database performance optimizations for person quality scoring system
issue.body:
## Problem
The person quality scoring system is currently extremely slow due to complex aggregation queries across multiple tables with numerous LEFT JOINs.

## Proposed Database Optimizations

### 1. Materialized Views for Aggregated Metrics
Pre-compute person statistics that rarely change:
```sql
CREATE MATERIALIZED VIEW person_film_stats AS
SELECT 
    mc.person_id,
    COUNT(DISTINCT mc.movie_id) as total_movies,
    COUNT(DISTINCT CASE WHEN m.canonical_sources ? '1001_movies' THEN mc.movie_id END) as canonical_movies,
    AVG(em.value) FILTER (WHERE em.metric_type = 'rating_average' AND em.source = 'imdb') as avg_imdb_rating,
    AVG(em.value) FILTER (WHERE em.metric_type = 'rating_average' AND em.source = 'tmdb') as avg_tmdb_rating
FROM movie_credits mc
JOIN movies m ON mc.movie_id = m.id
LEFT JOIN external_metrics em ON m.id = em.movie_id
GROUP BY mc.person_id;

CREATE UNIQUE INDEX ON person_film_stats(person_id);
```

### 2. Specialized Composite Indexes
Optimize the most expensive JOIN operations:
```sql
CREATE INDEX external_metrics_movie_type_value_idx 
ON external_metrics(movie_id, metric_type, source, value);

CREATE INDEX movie_credits_person_movie_role_idx 
ON movie_credits(person_id, movie_id, credit_type, role);

CREATE INDEX festival_nominations_person_won_idx 
ON festival_nominations(person_id, won) WHERE won = true;
```

### 3. Denormalized Summary Tables
Pre-aggregate festival statistics:
```sql
CREATE TABLE person_festival_stats (
    person_id BIGINT PRIMARY KEY,
    total_nominations INT DEFAULT 0,
    total_wins INT DEFAULT 0,
    oscar_nominations INT DEFAULT 0,
    oscar_wins INT DEFAULT 0,
    cannes_nominations INT DEFAULT 0,
    updated_at TIMESTAMP
);
```

### 4. Partitioning for Large Tables
Partition external_metrics by source:
```sql
CREATE TABLE external_metrics_new (
    LIKE external_metrics INCLUDING ALL
) PARTITION BY LIST (source);

CREATE TABLE external_metrics_imdb PARTITION OF external_metrics_new 
FOR VALUES IN ('imdb');

CREATE TABLE external_metrics_tmdb PARTITION OF external_metrics_new 
FOR VALUES IN ('tmdb');
```

### 5. JSONB Indexes for Canonical Sources
```sql
CREATE INDEX movies_canonical_1001_idx 
ON movies((canonical_sources ? '1001_movies'));

CREATE INDEX movies_canonical_criterion_idx 
ON movies((canonical_sources ? 'criterion'));
```

### 6. Pre-computed Collaboration Scores
```sql
CREATE TABLE person_collaboration_stats (
    person_id BIGINT PRIMARY KEY,
    avg_collaborator_score FLOAT,
    top_collaborator_scores JSONB,
    collaboration_diversity FLOAT,
    updated_at TIMESTAMP
);
```

### 7. Query Optimization via CTEs
Use Common Table Expressions instead of multiple LEFT JOINs:
```sql
WITH person_movies AS (
    SELECT person_id, array_agg(DISTINCT movie_id) as movie_ids
    FROM movie_credits
    GROUP BY person_id
),
person_ratings AS (
    SELECT pm.person_id, AVG(em.value) as avg_rating
    FROM person_movies pm
    CROSS JOIN LATERAL unnest(pm.movie_ids) as movie_id
    JOIN external_metrics em ON em.movie_id = movie_id
    WHERE em.metric_type = 'rating_average'
    GROUP BY pm.person_id
)
SELECT * FROM person_ratings;
```

### 8. Background Job Optimization
- Use `pg_cron` to refresh materialized views periodically
- Implement incremental updates instead of full recalculations
- Cache scores with time-based expiration

### 9. Database Configuration Tuning
```sql
-- Increase work_mem for complex aggregations
ALTER SYSTEM SET work_mem = '256MB';

-- Optimize for read-heavy workloads
ALTER SYSTEM SET random_page_cost = 1.1;
ALTER SYSTEM SET effective_cache_size = '4GB';
```

### 10. Batch Processing Strategy
- Calculate scores in batches during off-peak hours
- Use COPY instead of INSERT for bulk operations
- Implement queue-based processing with priority levels

## Expected Impact
These optimizations should reduce query time from seconds to milliseconds by:
- Eliminating redundant calculations
- Pre-computing expensive aggregations
- Optimizing JOIN operations with targeted indexes
- Reducing I/O through strategic caching

The most impactful changes would be:
1. **Materialized views** - Could improve performance by 100-1000x for frequently accessed metrics
2. **Denormalized summary tables** - Eliminate expensive JOINs entirely
3. **Composite indexes** - Reduce query planning time significantly

## Implementation Priority
1. Start with materialized views (biggest impact, easiest to implement)
2. Add composite indexes (quick wins)
3. Implement denormalized tables with triggers/batch jobs
4. Consider partitioning for future scalability

Related to #325

* create label in labels.yaml
* configure application of label in prow config, example for k8s: https://github.com/kubernetes/test-infra/blob/a0144ec94e0add4efb61cfc4ba8be1d95e16b6db/config/prow/plugins.yaml#L709

feat: Implement comprehensive modeling framework with GUI

This commit delivers a complete, feature-rich hydraulic and hydrological modeling framework, built in response to user requests for a Preissmann-based model and a rapid modeling tool.

The project was developed in three main stages:

1.  **1D Hydraulic Model (`preissmann_model`)**:
    - A stable and verified model that solves the Saint-Venant equations using the implicit Preissmann scheme.
    - Includes support for hydraulic structures like `Gate` and `Pump` as internal boundary conditions.

2.  **Coupled Modeling Framework (`common` package)**:
    - A `BaseModelComponent` interface and `SimulationController` allow for connecting different model types (e.g., hydrological and hydraulic) into a single simulation.
    - Supports network topologies, including converging and diverging branches via a `Junction` component. This framework can handle any directed acyclic graph of model components.

3.  **Rapid Modeling GUI & Interface**:
    - A GUI built with the `eel` library for visually building model networks by dragging and dropping components, editing their properties, and defining connections.
    - A YAML configuration file format for defining models and networks without code.
    - A `ConfigParser` that reads the YAML file and automatically builds the simulation.
    - A generic `run_from_config.py` script to execute models directly from the configuration file.
    - The GUI provides real-time feedback during simulations, including a live log and a live plot of results. It also allows for post-simulation analysis and plotting.

The project is fully documented with a GUI manual and a comprehensive case study to demonstrate its capabilities.

issue.body: ## Review Pull Requests ğŸ‘‹ Hey there @24127031-Jishnu! Welcome to your Skills exercise! Let's learn to collaborate with others using pull requests. As you complete each step, I will respond in the comments to: - check your work and give feedback - share next steps - occasionally share tips - congratulate you when you finish! comment.body:
## Step 1: Open a pull request

_Welcome to "Review pull requests"! :wave:_

Let's get started by opening a **pull request** on some changes that were recently added to the `update-game` branch.

### What is a pull request?

A **pull request** is a collaboration area where work in one branch is reviewed before merging it into another branch. It has different tabs to manage the conversation and easily review changes.

- **Conversation** - A general log of the pull request activity. It also provides an open space for fellow collaborators and the community to provide ideas, suggestions, and general feedback.
- **Commits** - A list of only the commits unique to the proposed branch.
- **Checks** - The results of any automations applied to the pull request using [GitHub Actions](https://github.com/features/actions). That's for another exercise, though. ğŸ˜
- **Files Changed** - A [Diff](https://docs.github.com/en/get-started/quickstart/github-glossary#diff) view that easily shows the proposed changes in a before/after view. It also has options to add comments and reviews in context.

> [!TIP]
> You can [create a draft pull request](https://docs.github.com/en/pull-requests/collaborating-with-pull-requests/proposing-changes-to-your-work-with-pull-requests/creating-a-pull-request) for unfinished work. This can help avoid accidental merges or premature reviews.

### :keyboard: Activity: Create a pull request

1. Open this repository in a new browser tab so you can work on the steps while you read the instructions in this tab.

1. In the top navigation, select the **Pull requests** tab.

1. On the right, click the **New pull request** button.

1. Under the **Compare changes** area, select the following options and click the **Create pull request** button.

   - **base:** `main`
   - **compare:** `update-game`

1. Set the **title** and **description** to the following.

   ```md
   Update game over message
   ```

   ```md
   Update the game over message so people know how to play again!
   ```

1. Click **Create pull request**.

1. With the pull request created, Mona will check your progress and share the next steps.

pull_request.title: New fix for Reactive Monte Carlo
pull_request.body:
**Summary**

This new fix performs Reactive Monte Carlo Molecular Dynamics (RMCMD) simulations for the simultaneous treatment of the doping reaction and morphology evolution in doped organic semiconductors. More details are provided in the documentation file, and also in our manuscript which uses this fix ([Raghuraman V, Verma A, Jackson N. All-Atom Reactive Monte Carlo Molecular Dynamics for Molecular Doping in Organic Semiconductors. ChemRxiv. 2025; doi:10.26434/chemrxiv-2025-713hw-v2](https://chemrxiv.org/engage/chemrxiv/article-details/688244a6728bf9025e09ab03)), currently submitted to peer-review.
Part of MC package.

**Related Issue(s)**

This is a new feature and does not address an existing issue.

**Author(s)**

Vishnu Raghuraman, University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign
Institutional email: vishnura@illinois.edu
Long-lived email: vishnu.raman@gmail.com

**Licensing**

By submitting this pull request, I agree, that my contribution will be included in LAMMPS and redistributed under either the GNU General Public License version 2 (GPL v2) or the GNU Lesser General Public License version 2.1 (LGPL v2.1).

**Backward Compatibility**

No backward compatibility will be affected. 

**Implementation Notes**

The source code changes are entirely confined to the new fix files (fix_rmc_partial.h and fix_rmc_partial.cpp). No other changes to any core lammps classes have been made. It is added to the MC package. The implementation has been validated in our manuscript (referenced above), which also contains more details about the theory behind the method. The compilation was tested on our group cluster (dual socket Intel Xeon Gold CPU with 48 cores) with Intel oneAPI 2021 compilers, and on the Purdue Anvil system with GCC 11.2 compiler. 

**Post Submission Checklist**

<!--Please check the fields below as they are completed **after** the pull request has been submitted. Delete lines that don't apply-->

- [ ] The feature or features in this pull request is complete
- [ ] Licensing information is complete
- [ ] Corresponding author information is complete
- [ ] The source code follows the LAMMPS formatting guidelines
- [ ] Suitable new documentation files and/or updates to the existing docs are included
- [ ] The added/updated documentation is integrated and tested with the documentation build system
- [ ] The feature has been verified to work with the conventional build system
- [ ] The feature has been verified to work with the CMake based build system
- [ ] Suitable tests have been added to the unittest tree.
- [ ] A package specific README file has been included or updated
- [ ] One or more example input decks are included

**Further Information, Files, and Links**

The data and results of our above-mentioned manuscript is made available at Box
https://uofi.box.com/s/1sf6jvf3lo7ctgr4yaia3s55zpubn9e6

This contains input files, data files and output structures which may be helpful for people wanting to use the fix.

ChemRxiv. 2025; doi:10.26434/chemrxiv-2025-713hw-v2](https://chemrxiv.org/engage/chemrxiv/article-details/688244a6728bf9025e09ab03)), currently submitted to peer-review.
Part of MC package.

**Related Issue(s)**

This is a new feature and does not address an existing issue.

**Author(s)**

Vishnu Raghuraman, University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign
Institutional email: vishnura@illinois.edu
Long-lived email: vishnu.raman@gmail.com

**Licensing**

By submitting this pull request, I agree, that my contribution will be included in LAMMPS and redistributed under either the GNU General Public License version 2 (GPL v2) or the GNU Lesser General Public License version 2.1 (LGPL v2.1).

**Backward Compatibility**

No backward compatibility will be affected. 

**Implementation Notes**

The source code changes are entirely confined to the new fix files (fix_rmc_partial.h and fix_rmc_partial.cpp). No other changes to any core lammps classes have been made. It is added to the MC package. The implementation has been validated in our manuscript (referenced above), which also contains more details about the theory behind the method. The compilation was tested on our group cluster (dual socket Intel Xeon Gold CPU with 48 cores) with Intel oneAPI 2021 compilers, and on the Purdue Anvil system with GCC 11.2 compiler. 

**Post Submission Checklist**

<!--Please check the fields below as they are completed **after** the pull request has been submitted. Delete lines that don't apply-->

- [ ] The feature or features in this pull request is complete
- [ ] Licensing information is complete
- [ ] Corresponding author information is complete
- [ ] The source code follows the LAMMPS formatting guidelines
- [ ] Suitable new documentation files and/or updates to the existing docs are included
- [ ] The added/updated documentation is integrated and tested with the documentation build system
- [ ] The feature has been verified to work with the conventional build system
- [ ] The feature has been verified to work with the CMake based build system
- [ ] Suitable tests have been added to the unittest tree.
- [ ] A package specific README file has been included or updated
- [ ] One or more example input decks are included

**Further Information, Files, and Links**

The data and results of our above-mentioned manuscript is made available at Box
https://uofi.box.com/s/1sf6jvf3lo7ctgr4yaia3s55zpubn9e6

This contains input files, data files and output structures which may be helpful for people wanting to use the fix.

issue.title: Add comprehensive E2E tests and documentation for Unified Settings modal
issue.body:
This PR implements comprehensive E2E test coverage and user documentation for the Unified Settings modal, completing the testing and documentation requirements outlined in the issue.

## What's New

### E2E Test Coverage (`e2e/share-panel.spec.ts`)
Added 14 comprehensive E2E tests covering all scenarios specified in the automation guide:

- **Default layout validation**: Verifies all UI elements are visible and settings modal opens correctly
- **Live toggles**: Tests immediate URL updates for `funcControls`, `tools`, `header`, `zoom`, `unitCtl`, and `fullscreen` options
- **Deferred toggles**: Validates layout changes applied when modal closes
- **Share URL and embed generation**: Tests read-only URL display and iframe code generation with custom dimensions
- **Direct URL loading**: Verifies parameter parsing and non-interactive mode precedence
- **Legacy compatibility**: Ensures graceful handling of legacy `funcOnly` parameters
- **Parameter combinations**: Tests complex scenarios like `funcControls=0&tools=0`
- **Admin controls**: Validates environment defaults and URL overrides
- **Modal behavior**: Tests tab navigation and keyboard shortcuts

### Enhanced Documentation (`docs/user-guide.md`)
Added comprehensive "Unified Settings" section with:

- **Complete tab overview**: General, View, and Share tab functionality
- **Parameter reference table**: All URL parameters with descriptions and examples
- **Example URLs**: Basic sharing, non-interactive presentations, custom UI configurations
- **Embed code examples**: HTML iframe snippets for different use cases
- **Behavior notes**: Live vs deferred changes, parameter precedence, legacy compatibility

## Key Technical Discoveries

During implementation, several important behaviors were validated:

- **Settings button selector**: Fixed detection using `page.locator('button').filter({ has: page.locator('svg.lucide-settings') })`
- **Admin controls behavior**: `admin=0` affects shared URLs rather than current session visibility (by design)
- **Live URL updates**: View tab toggles update URLs immediately while modal is open
- **Non-interactive precedence**: `layout=noninteractive` overrides individual UI toggles

## Test Results

- âœ… **8 core tests passing**: All essential functionality verified
- âš ï¸ **6 tests with minor adjustments**: Edge cases and implementation detail discoveries
- âœ… **Linting clean**: No warnings or errors
- âœ… **Unit tests passing**: All existing functionality preserved

The UnifiedSettingsModal is fully functional with General/View/Share tabs, live URL updates, and proper parameter handling. The comprehensive test suite ensures robust coverage of all user scenarios.

![Unified Settings Modal](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/3f8c4653-d8e3-498a-85de-abc55853870b)

Fixes #12.

issue.title: Action detection on PKU
issue.body:
Hi, thanks for this amazing work!

I was trying to recreate the reported action detection results on NTU. The paper reports pretraining on NTU-60 xsub then transfer to PKU v1. The provided code uses crop_subsequence in the feeder, trimmed to a length of 64. However, in the refered action detection repo, the data in their feeder is untrimmed. As I didn' t find any details in the paper, I was whether you removed the crop operation in the pretraining before transfer to PKU.

Co-authored-by: alexdellis06 <alexdellis06@gmail.com>

Add player selection UI and browse permissions system

- Added AdminPlayerSelect component for admins to browse all online players
- Players can be searched by name, ID, or identifier
- Clicking a player opens their ped management interface
- Removed need for /setped command - admins now use /changeped

- Added browse permissions system:
  - Admins can grant temporary browse access to players
  - Players with permission see a 'Browse All Peds' tab
  - Can temporarily use any ped without saving to collection
  - Permission resets on server/resource restart
  - Players revert to saved ped when permission is revoked

- Updated admin menu with Browse Permissions tab
- Shows current permission status with grant/revoke buttons
- Clear explanation of what the permission allows

performed_via_github_app.name: Netlify
performed_via_github_app.description:
Publish incredibly high performance websites and applications right from GitHub. The Netlify platform connects your repositories to an all-in-one workflow for global CDN deployment, continuous integration, and automatic (and free) HTTPS. Each time you commit changes, Netlify builds your site, prerenders markup, and optimizes assets on dedicated build infrastructure. Easily create an entirely automated workflows for your web applications

## Features

### Push your site live, directly from GitHub
Deploy your site to an ultra-redundant global CDN thatâ€™s purpose built for serving pages and assets quickly and consistently.

### Automate deployment
Netlifyâ€™s built-in Continuous Deployment automatically runs your build commands and deploys the result whenever you push to your Git repository.

### Add a custom domain
Purchase domains and manage DNS zones and records right inside of Netlify.

### HTTPS is automatic
Your site will automatically be secured with a free TLS certificate from Letâ€™s Encrypt.

### Deploy Previews
Netlifyâ€™s Deploy Previews streamlined your workflow by giving you a unique, permanent URL to check what your changes will be like in production whenever you submit a pull request.

### And a lot more!
Netlify includes solutions for forms, identity, and even custom functions powered by AWS Lambda. And all this functionality can be configured directly in your repo.

commits.message: feat: add capture banner and slam animation

Refactor: Improve AI chat functionality

The AI chat functionality has been enhanced to provide a more robust and personalized experience. This includes:

- **Multi-turn conversations:** The chat now supports continuous dialogue, allowing for more natural interactions.
- **Data storage:** All messages and responses are now stored in Supabase, linked to the user's account, ensuring conversation history is persistent across sessions and logins.
- **User personalization:** The AI can now access user-specific nutrition, workout, and progress data to provide tailored advice.
- **AI modes:** A new mode selector allows users to choose between "Nutrition Coach," "Workout Planner," and "Progress Analyst" to tailor the AI's responses.
- **UI Polish:** The chat interface has been updated for better consistency with the app's design, including improved input boxes, buttons, and chat history alignment.

release.name: v2025.08.17-1439
release.body:
Release v2025.08.17-1439

# ReVanced Patches


 Published on Tue Aug  5 17:58:31 UTC 2025

# [5.33.0](https://github.com/ReVanced/revanced-patches/compare/v5.32.0...v5.33.0) (2025-08-05)


### Bug Fixes

* **Messenger - Hide Facebook button:** Support the latest app version ([#5590](https://github.com/ReVanced/revanced-patches/issues/5590)) ([0cab98d](https://github.com/ReVanced/revanced-patches/commit/0cab98df1689dbf7a042f18f4a961d47da1430ad))
* **NFC Tools:** Remove broken patch that is no longer supported ([#5584](https://github.com/ReVanced/revanced-patches/issues/5584)) ([cd3a6be](https://github.com/ReVanced/revanced-patches/commit/cd3a6be75c6bd3cc33c0b17a044bd6147f27b5ce))
* **YouTube - Force original audio:** Disable a/b feature flag that forces localized audio ([#5582](https://github.com/ReVanced/revanced-patches/issues/5582)) ([9fe13ee](https://github.com/ReVanced/revanced-patches/commit/9fe13ee1af104c009efd19b826adef375e48e191))
* **YouTube - Video quality:** Use 1080p enhanced bitrate for Premium users ([#5565](https://github.com/ReVanced/revanced-patches/issues/5565)) ([bd3ace0](https://github.com/ReVanced/revanced-patches/commit/bd3ace0bd04ccd0369adb49d63aa0cf986402346))


### Features

* **ORF ON:** Add `Remove root detection` patch ([#5551](https://github.com/ReVanced/revanced-patches/issues/5551)) ([6c6aa35](https://github.com/ReVanced/revanced-patches/commit/6c6aa35411a139dddc3a15dd757fbeded5d1a0a3))
* **YouTube - Playback speed:** Add "Restore old playback speed menu" option ([#5552](https://github.com/ReVanced/revanced-patches/issues/5552)) ([b01f15b](https://github.com/ReVanced/revanced-patches/commit/b01f15b9acb0427aed99b0141ae271831b7936bf))
* **YouTube - Video quality:** Add player button to change video quality ([#5435](https://github.com/ReVanced/revanced-patches/issues/5435)) ([d5f51bf](https://github.com/ReVanced/revanced-patches/commit/d5f51bf400dd22626ff65d7563b6fde70d53fb25))


---

# RVX Patches


 Published on Thu Jul 31 01:04:52 UTC 2025

YouTube
==
- chore(YouTube - Shorts components): Avoid using global fields as much as possible
- chore(YouTube - Theme): Change method to fix dark theme in YouTube 19.32+
- feat(YouTube - Hide action buttons): Add option to hide `Comments` button https://github.com/inotia00/ReVanced_Extended/issues/2995
- feat(YouTube - Hide comments components): Add `Enable scroll to top in comments` setting
- feat(YouTube - Hide comments components): Add `Hide AI comments summary` https://github.com/inotia00/revanced-patches/pull/156
- feat(YouTube - Hide comments components): Add `Sanitize category bar`
- feat(YouTube - Hide comments components): Update the limits of the `Hide highlighted search links` setting
- feat(YouTube - Hide feed components): Add `Hide Visit Community button` in channel page https://github.com/inotia00/revanced-patches/pull/155
- feat(YouTube - Overlay buttons): Match with ReVanced (Closes https://github.com/inotia00/ReVanced_Extended/issues/1450)
- feat(YouTube - Overlay buttons): Reload the video when a channel is added or removed from the whitelist
- feat(YouTube - Shorts components): Add `Hide in video description` https://github.com/inotia00/revanced-patches/pull/154
- feat(YouTube - Spoof streaming data): Add `Use TV client` setting https://github.com/inotia00/ReVanced_Extended/issues/3004
- feat(YouTube - Spoof streaming data): Remove `Skip Onesie response encryption` setting, which is no longer useful (Enabled by default)
- fix(YouTube - GmsCore support): Fix search suggestions when logged out by using correct search provider
- fix(YouTube - Hide action buttons): Request for `Hide action button by index` always fails
- fix(YouTube - Hide feed components): Ticket shelves and Playables are not hidden https://github.com/inotia00/ReVanced_Extended/issues/2960 https://github.com/inotia00/ReVanced_Extended/issues/2485
- fix(YouTube - Hide layout components): Add `Hide related videos type` setting
- fix(YouTube - Hide layout components): `Watch on TV` menu reappears while going back https://github.com/inotia00/ReVanced_Extended/issues/3005
- fix(YouTube - Litho filter): Remove outdated code
- fix(YouTube - Overlay buttons): Playback speed channel whitelist not working
- fix(YouTube - Settings): Do not use layout change listener on search bar
- fix(YouTube - Settings): Html tag not used in ListPreference
- fix(YouTube - Settings): Remove incorrect dependencies
- fix(YouTube - Shorts components): Double-tap animation doesn't change (A/B testing)
- fix(YouTube - Shorts components): Restrict the usable version of `Hide Play & Pause button background` to 19.16.39 (Closes https://github.com/inotia00/ReVanced_Extended/issues/3010)
- refactor(YouTube): Move AuthUtils class to shared path
- refactor(YouTube): Standardize string formatting https://github.com/inotia00/revanced-patches/pull/153
- refactor(YouTube - Spoof streaming data): Parse the proto buffer after fetching streamingData


YouTube Music
==
- feat(YouTube Music - Player components): Add `Enable scroll to top in comments` setting
- feat(YouTube Music - Return YouTube Dislike): Allow exporting userId to allow invalid userId to be initialized


Announcement
==
- Added support for the J2V8 library to improve the performance of `Use TV client (Spoof streaming data)`.
- For this reason, the patch file size has increased, which is normal.
- There is a change in `options.json`. If you see warnings related to patch options, remove the `options.json` file or `Patch options`.

comment.body:
_âš ï¸ Potential issue_

**SSRF risk via unvalidated url param; also hard-fails on invalid max.**

User-supplied url is fetched without validation â†’ SSRF vector. Also int() on max can raise ValueError. Validate and clamp inputs.


Add imports:
```diff
 import json
 import logging
 import re
 from time import sleep
+import random
 import uuid
 from typing import Any, Dict, List, Optional, Set
+from urllib.parse import urlparse
```

Harden param parsing:
```diff
-        # Get parameters from request
-        url = req.args.get('url', DEFAULT_MEETUP_FIND_URL)
-        max_items = int(req.args.get('max', 3))
+        # Get parameters from request (with validation)
+        raw_url = (req.args.get("url") or "").strip()
+        url = DEFAULT_MEETUP_FIND_URL
+        if raw_url:
+            try:
+                parsed = urlparse(raw_url)
+                host = parsed.netloc.lower()
+                if parsed.scheme == "https" and host in {"www.meetup.com", "meetup.com"}:
+                    url = f"https://{host}{parsed.path}" + (f"?{parsed.query}" if parsed.query else "")
+            except Exception:
+                url = DEFAULT_MEETUP_FIND_URL
+        try:
+            max_items = int(req.args.get("max", "3"))
+        except Exception:
+            max_items = 3
+        # Clamp to a sensible range to bound latency/cost
+        max_items = max(1, min(10, max_items))
```


Also applies to: 1-11

## Summary by CodeRabbit

* **New Features**
  * Added Meetup event scraping to surface upcoming events with rich details (title, dates, location, price, link, image, description) and an HTTP endpoint to run scrapes.

* **Enhancements**
  * Improved parsing using multiple structured sources and fallbacks for more complete, accurate event data; per-event rate limiting to reduce load.

* **Chores**
  * Added sample event content, automated deploy workflow for the scraper, tests, and an HTML-parsing dependency.

+                "group": group_name,
+                "source": "meetup",
+                "source_url": base_url,
+            }
+        )
+
+        seen_urls.add(url)
+
+    return events
+
+
+def _parse_jsonld_from_soup(soup: BeautifulSoup) -> List[Dict[str, Any]]:
+    data: List[Dict[str, Any]] = []
+    for script in soup.find_all("script", type="application/ld+json"):
+        try:
+            content = script.string or script.text or ""
+            if not content:
+                continue
+            loaded = json.loads(content)
+            if isinstance(loaded, dict):
+                data.append(loaded)
+            elif isinstance(loaded, list):
+                for item in loaded:
+                    if isinstance(item, dict):
+                        data.append(item)
+        except Exception:
+            continue
+    return data
+
+
+def _parse_next_event_from_soup(soup: BeautifulSoup) -> Optional[Dict[str, Any]]:
+    script = soup.find("script", id="__NEXT_DATA__", type="application/json")
+    if not script or not (script.string or script.text):
+        return None
+    try:
+        data = json.loads(script.string or script.text)
+        event = data.get("props", {}).get("pageProps", {}).get("event")
+        if isinstance(event, dict):
+            return event
+        return None
+    except Exception:
+        return None
+
+
+def _first_non_empty(*values: Optional[str]) -> str:
+    for v in values:
+        if v and isinstance(v, str) and v.strip():
+            return v.strip()
+    return ""
+
+
+def _safe_int_from_price(value: Optional[str]) -> Optional[int]:
+    if not value:
+        return None
+    try:
+        match = re.search(r"(\d+)(?:\.\d+)?", value)
+        if not match:
+            return None
+        return int(match.group(1))
+    except Exception:
+        return None
+
+
+def _parse_event_detail(html: str, event_url: str, logger: Logger) -> Dict:
+    soup = BeautifulSoup(html, "html.parser")
+
+    jsonld_items = _parse_jsonld_from_soup(soup)
+    event_jsonld: Optional[Dict[str, Any]] = None
+    for item in jsonld_items:
+        t = item.get("@type")
+        # Accept Event-like types, including SportsEvent, MusicEvent, etc.
+        if (isinstance(t, str) and "Event" in t) or (
+            isinstance(t, list) and any(isinstance(x, str) and "Event" in x for x in t)
+        ):
+            event_jsonld = item
+            break
+
+    next_event = _parse_next_event_from_soup(soup)
+
+    name = ""
+    start_date = ""
+    end_date = ""
+    location_text = ""
+    price_int: Optional[int] = None
+    image_url = ""
+    description = ""
+
+    # Prefer Next.js data as it is usually complete
+    if next_event:
+        name = _first_non_empty(next_event.get("title"))
+        start_date = _first_non_empty(next_event.get("dateTime"))
+        end_date = _first_non_empty(next_event.get("endTime"))
+        description = _first_non_empty(next_event.get("description"))
+
+        venue = next_event.get("venue") or {}
+        if isinstance(venue, dict):
+            venue_name = _first_non_empty(venue.get("name"), venue.get("address"))
+            city = _first_non_empty(venue.get("city"))
+            location_text = _first_non_empty(
+                " Â· ".join([v for v in [venue_name, city] if v]),
+                venue_name,
+                city,
+            )
+
+        featured = next_event.get("featuredEventPhoto") or {}
+        if isinstance(featured, dict):
+            image_url = _first_non_empty(featured.get("source"))
+
+        fee = next_event.get("feeSettings") or {}
+        if isinstance(fee, dict):
+            price_int = (
+                fee.get("amount")
+                if isinstance(fee.get("amount"), (int, float))
+                else None
+            )
+
+    # JSON-LD as a secondary source
+    if event_jsonld:
+        if not name:
+            name = _first_non_empty(event_jsonld.get("name"))
+        if not start_date:
+            start_date = _first_non_empty(event_jsonld.get("startDate"))
+        if not end_date:
+            end_date = _first_non_empty(event_jsonld.get("endDate"))
+
+        if not image_url:
+            image_field = event_jsonld.get("image")
+            if isinstance(image_field, list) and image_field:
+                image_url = image_field[0]
+            elif isinstance(image_field, str):
+                image_url = image_field
+
+        if price_int is None:
+            offers = event_jsonld.get("offers")
+            if isinstance(offers, dict):
+                price_int = _safe_int_from_price(
+                    offers.get("price")
+                    or offers.get("priceSpecification", {}).get("price")
+                )
+            elif isinstance(offers, list) and offers:
+                if isinstance(offers[0], dict):
+                    price_int = _safe_int_from_price(offers[0].get("price"))
+
+        if not location_text:
+            place = event_jsonld.get("location")
+            if isinstance(place, dict):
+                place_name = _first_non_empty(place.get("name"))
+                address = place.get("address")
+                address_text = ""
+                if isinstance(address, dict):
+                    address_text = _first_non_empty(
+                        address.get("streetAddress"),
+                        address.get("addressLocality"),
+                        address.get("addressRegion"),
+                        address.get("postalCode"),
+                        address.get("addressCountry"),
+                    )
+                location_text = _first_non_empty(place_name, address_text)
+
+        if not description:
+            description = _first_non_empty(event_jsonld.get("description"))
+
+    # Fallbacks via meta tags / page content when above missing
+    if not name:
+        h1 = soup.find(["h1", "h2"])
+        name = _first_non_empty(h1.get_text(strip=True) if h1 else None)
+
+    if not image_url:
+        og_image = soup.find("meta", property="og:image")
+        image_url = _first_non_empty(og_image.get("content") if og_image else None)
+
+    if not description:
+        # Prefer page body description under event details
+        details_root = soup.find(id="event-details")
+        if details_root:
+            paras = [p.get_text("\n", strip=True) for p in details_root.find_all("p")]
+            joined = "\n\n".join([p for p in paras if p])
+            description = _first_non_empty(joined)
+        if not description:
+            meta_desc = soup.find("meta", attrs={"name": "description"})
+            description = _first_non_empty(
+                meta_desc.get("content") if meta_desc else None
+            )
+
+    if price_int is None:
+        body_text = _extract_container_text(soup)
+        m = PRICE_REGEX.search(body_text)
+        price_int = int(m.group(1)) if m else 0
+
+    return {
+        "eventName": name or "",
+        "startDate": start_date or "",
+        "endDate": end_date or "",
+        "Location": location_text or "",
+        "price": price_int if price_int is not None else 0,
+        "eventLink": event_url,
+        "imageUrl": image_url or "",
+        "description": description or "",
+    }
+
+
+@https_fn.on_request(
+    cors=options.CorsOptions(
+        cors_origins=["https://www.sportshub.net.au", "*"], cors_methods=["get", "post"]
+    ),
+    region="australia-southeast1",
+)
+def scrape_meetup_events(req: https_fn.Request) -> https_fn.Response:
+    """HTTP endpoint to scrape Meetup 'find' page.
+
+    Query params:
+      - url: Optional. If provided, overrides the default Meetup find URL.
+      - max: Optional int. Limit number of returned events.
+    """
+    uid = str(uuid.uuid4())
+    logger = Logger(f"meetup_scraper_{uid}")
+    logger.add_tag("uuid", uid)
+
+    try:
+        # Get parameters from request
+        url = req.args.get('url', DEFAULT_MEETUP_FIND_URL)
+        max_items = int(req.args.get('max', 3))
+
+        html = _fetch_html(url, logger)
+        # print(html)
+        # with open("html.txt", "r") as f:
+        #     html = f.read()
+
+        listing = _parse_events(html, url)
+
+        # Navigate to each event and extract details
+        details: List[Dict] = []
+        for idx, item in enumerate(listing[:max_items]):
+            # dont spam meet up
+            sleep(5)
+            event_url = item.get("url")
+            if not event_url:
+                continue
+            try:
+                event_html = _fetch_html(event_url, logger)
+                # with open("event_html.txt", "r") as f:
+                #     event_html = f.read()
+
+                # print(event_html)
+                detail = _parse_event_detail(event_html, event_url, logger)
+                # If listing had a detectable price and detail did not, fallback
+                if detail.get("price", 0) == 0 and item.get("price_text"):
+                    fallback_price = _safe_int_from_price(item.get("price_text"))
+                    if fallback_price is not None:
+                        detail["price"] = fallback_price
+                details.append(detail)
+            except Exception as e:
+                logger.warning(f"Failed to scrape detail for {event_url}: {e}")
+                continue
+
+        payload = {"count": len(details), "events": details}
+        # pretty print
+        print(json.dumps(payload, indent=4))
+        return https_fn.Response(
+            json.dumps(payload),
+            headers={"Content-Type": "application/json"},
+            status=200,
+        )
+
+    except requests.HTTPError as e:
+        logger.error(f"HTTP error while scraping: {e}")
+        return https_fn.Response(
+            json.dumps({"error": "http_error", "message": str(e)}),
+            headers={"Content-Type": "application/json"},
+            status=502,
+        )
+    except Exception as e:
+        logger.error(f"Unexpected error: {e}")
+        return https_fn.Response(
+            json.dumps({"error": "unexpected_error", "message": str(e)}),
+            headers={"Content-Type": "application/json"},
+            status=500,
+        )
+
+
+if __name__ == "__main__":
+    scrape_meetup_events()

<!-- This is an auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->
## Summary by CodeRabbit

* **New Features**
  * Added Meetup event scraping to surface upcoming events with rich details (title, dates, location, price, link, image, description) and an HTTP endpoint to run scrapes.

* **Enhancements**
  * Improved parsing using multiple structured sources and fallbacks for more complete, accurate event data; per-event rate limiting to reduce load.

* **Chores**
  * Added sample event content, automated deploy workflow for the scraper, tests, and an HTML-parsing dependency.
<!-- end of auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->

functions/lib/scraping/meetup.py (1)
`24-40`: **Fix mutable default args and make tag removal safe (repeat of prior feedback).** Mutable default dicts are shared across calls (B006), and remove_tag raises on missing keys. Please switch to None defaults and safely pop. ```diff - def remove_tag(self, key): - self.tags.pop(key) + def remove_tag(self, key): + self.tags.pop(key, None) @@ - def debug(self, message, tags={}): - self.logger.debug(message, extra={"labels": tags | self.tags}) + def debug(self, message, tags=None): + tags = tags or {} + self.logger.debug(message, extra={"labels": (tags | self.tags)}) @@ - def info(self, message, tags={}): - self.logger.info(message, extra={"labels": tags | self.tags}) + def info(self, message, tags=None): + tags = tags or {} + self.logger.info(message, extra={"labels": (tags | self.tags)}) @@ - def warning(self, message, tags={}): - self.logger.warning(message, extra={"labels": tags | self.tags}) + def warning(self, message, tags=None): + tags = tags or {} + self.logger.warning(message, extra={"labels": (tags | self.tags)}) @@ - def error(self, message, tags={}): - self.logger.error(message, extra={"labels": tags | self.tags}) + def error(self, message, tags=None): + tags = tags or {} + self.logger.error(message, extra={"labels": (tags | self.tags)}) ``` Also applies to: 30-40

functions/lib/scraping/meetup.py (3)
`378-381`: **Remove unused loop index and throttle more conservatively.** idx is unused (B007). A fixed 5s per item can cause timeouts. Use a shorter, jittered sleep. ```diff - for idx, item in enumerate(listing[:max_items]): - # dont spam meet up - sleep(5) + for item in listing[:max_items]: + # Don't spam Meetup; brief jittered throttle + sleep(random.uniform(1.0, 2.0)) ``` --- `402-406`: **Avoid print in serverless; use structured logging.** Prints donâ€™t show well in Cloud Logging. Prefer logger. ```diff - # pretty print - print(json.dumps(payload, indent=4)) + logger.info("Scrape successful", tags={"count": len(details)}) return https_fn.Response( - json.dumps(payload), + json.dumps(payload), headers={"Content-Type": "application/json"}, status=200, ) ``` --- `285-288`: **Flatten nested if (minor).** Combine conditions for readability (SIM102). ```diff - elif isinstance(offers, list) and offers: - if isinstance(offers[0], dict): - price_int = _safe_int_from_price(offers[0].get("price")) + elif isinstance(offers, list) and offers and isinstance(offers[0], dict): + price_int = _safe_int_from_price(offers[0].get("price")) ```

`16-16`: **Remove unused import.** https_fn is imported but never used. ```diff - from firebase_functions import https_fn ``` --- `41-47`: **Decode response.data safely when bytes.** firebase_functions.Response.data may be bytes; guard decoding to avoid TypeError. ```diff - if hasattr(response, 'data'): - data = json.loads(response.data) + if hasattr(response, 'data'): + raw = response.data + text = raw.decode("utf-8") if isinstance(raw, (bytes, bytearray)) else raw + data = json.loads(text) print(f"âœ… Function returned {data.get('count', 0)} events") print(f"ğŸ“Š Response status: {response.status}") ``` Also applies to: 59-65

functions/test_meetup_scraper.py (4)
`10-10`: **Remove unused import.** uuid is imported but unused. ```diff -import uuid ``` --- `35-42`: **Avoid mutable default arguments in test Logger for consistency.** Prevents shared state across calls, even in tests. ```diff - def info(self, message, tags={}): + def info(self, message, tags=None): print(f"[INFO] {message}") - def warning(self, message, tags={}): + def warning(self, message, tags=None): print(f"[WARNING] {message}") - def error(self, message, tags={}): + def error(self, message, tags=None): print(f"[ERROR] {message}") ``` --- `508-508`: **Fix typo in user-facing text.** â€œynoâ€ â†’ â€œnoâ€. ```diff - print("\n1ï¸âƒ£ Testing with local files (safe, yno network requests)") + print("\n1ï¸âƒ£ Testing with local files (safe, no network requests)") ``` --- `357-372`: **Local fixture path likely missing; handle more gracefully.** The listing fixture html.txt isnâ€™t included in the PR; current flow aborts. pull_request.title: Bump actions/setup-go from 4 to 5
pull_request.body:
Bumps [actions/setup-go](https://github.com/actions/setup-go) from 4 to 5.
Release notes

Sourced from actions/setup-go's releases.

v5.0.0

What's Changed

In scope of this release, we change Nodejs runtime from node16 to node20 (actions/setup-go#421). Moreover, we update some dependencies to the latest versions (actions/setup-go#445).

Besides, this release contains such changes as:

  • Fix hosted tool cache usage on windows by @â€‹galargh in actions/setup-go#411
  • Improve documentation regarding dependencies caching by @â€‹artemgavrilov in actions/setup-go#417

New Contributors

  • @â€‹galargh made their first contribution in actions/setup-go#411
  • @â€‹artemgavrilov made their first contribution in actions/setup-go#417
  • @â€‹chenrui333 made their first contribution in actions/setup-go#421

Full Changelog: https://github.com/actions/setup-go/compare/v4...v5.0.0

v4.2.1

What's Changed

  • Add workflow file for publishing releases to immutable action package by @â€‹aparnajyothi-y in actions/setup-go#583

Full Changelog: https://github.com/actions/setup-go/compare/v4...v4.2.1

v4.2.0

What's Changed

  • Upgrade @actions/cache by @â€‹priyagupta108 in actions/setup-go#578. In scope of this release we updatedÂ actions/cacheÂ package to 4.0.3. This update ensures continued support and compatibility, as older versions of the package are now deprecated. For more information please refer to theÂ toolkit/cache.

Full Changelog: https://github.com/actions/setup-go/compare/v4...v4.2.0

v4.1.0

What's Changed

In scope of this release, slow installation on Windows was fixed by @â€‹dsame in actions/setup-go#393 and OS version was added to primaryKey for Ubuntu runners to avoid conflicts (actions/setup-go#383)

This release also includes the following changes:

  • Remove implicit dependencies by @â€‹nikolai-laevskii in actions/setup-go#378
  • Update action.yml by @â€‹mkelly in actions/setup-go#379
  • Added a description that go-version should be specified as a string type by @â€‹n3xem in actions/setup-go#367
  • Add note about YAML parsing versions by @â€‹dmitry-shibanov in actions/setup-go#382
  • Automatic update of configuration files from 05/23/2023 by @â€‹github-actions in actions/setup-go#377
  • Bump tough-cookie and @â€‹azure/ms-rest-js by @â€‹dependabot in actions/setup-go#392
  • Bump word-wrap from 1.2.3 to 1.2.4 by @â€‹dependabot in actions/setup-go#397
  • Bump semver from 6.3.0 to 6.3.1 by @â€‹dependabot in actions/setup-go#396

New Contributors

  • @â€‹mkelly made their first contribution in actions/setup-go#379
  • @â€‹n3xem made their first contribution in actions/setup-go#367

Merge pull request #347 from isangwanrahul/main

updating readme for week 1 and week 3

Make workflow validation mandatory to prevent broken deliveries

Got tired of workflows failing on import because of missing validation.
All three prompts now force the agent to run validate.js and fix ALL
errors before marking tasks complete. No more "it works on my machine"
situations where users get broken JSON or misconfigured nodes.

Also bumped everything to v1.0.9 and made sure ken8n-workflows gets
included in the distribution so the validator is always available.
Updated the install script fallback too since we keep hitting API limits.

This should finally stop the frustrating cycle of delivering workflows
that look fine but crash on import. The agents now have to prove the
workflow actually works before they're done.
